BUNCH: A group of similar things, either growing together, or in a cluster or clump, usually fastened together.
CIRCLE: A two-dimensional geometric figure, a line, consisting of the set of all those points in a plane that are equally distant from a given point (center).
CLIQUE: A small, exclusive group of individuals, usually according to lifestyle or social status; a cabal.
CLUB: An association of members joining together for some common purpose, especially sports or recreation.
CROWD: A group of people congregated or collected into a close body without order.
GROUP: A number of things or persons being in some relation to one another.
SOCIETY: A long-standing group of people sharing cultural aspects such as language, dress, norms of behavior and artistic forms.
